review_title: Glad to be out of here
pros: The only pro I can think of is the people I've worked with. My team and line managers were great to work with.
cons: Very inflexible, not a lot of work-life balance. Expected to do 2-3 people's workload with not a lot of recognition. No opportunity to progress, nepotism, few senior managers keep being regurgitated by being moved around departments, with not a lot of accountability. Many team leaders like to micro-manage their team, so you never feel trusted. The general culture is like being back in primary school (on one occasion an employee was put in a time-out for looking at their phone) Since the mass redundancies were announced HR an senior management proved day after day how little they care about the employees' lives. They're treated with disrespect and don't get a lot of support. I could go on all day, but probably anyone reading this gets the idea of how toxic a working environment to expect. I would have given zero stars, if I had the option.

pros: The work isn't difficult if you pay attention.
cons: They would pay you less if it weren't illegal to. Just very cheap overall. They refuse to buy new equipment and insist that the outdated system is fine. This is the only job I've ever had that takes money out of your check for mistakes. They also hire the bare minimum amount of employees. In the 3 months I've been there we haven't been fully staffed for a full week yet. Also, since everyone leaves so quickly, I started training new hires when I had only been there for 3 weeks. We're also not allowed to wear shorts despite working in very hot temperatures in an underground tunnel system. Overall it's just very apparent that they don't have any appreciation for their employees.

review_title: Good company but lots of room for improvement
pros: Canon gives back to the community. Blood drives, clothing drives, Breast Cancer sponsor, National Center for Missing and Exploited Children sponsor, Earth Day events, etc. Great products, good building and location. Nice cafeteria
cons: Salaries need to be higher. Not a good company to balance work and personal life. If you arrive at 9:01AM you are late. You cannot "leave early", you must take personal time. When salaried most companies let you work thru lunch or come in early to leave 30 minutes early. No working from home, but if company is closed due to weather, you are expected to work from home if needed. No official comp day policy for travel. Some managers do not communicate well, and other communication issues levels across the boards. Favoritism

ltant in Singapore
Recommend
CEO Approval
Business Outlook
Pros
Japanese ideals, good management structure, helpful and approachable bosses. Basically, has a calm and stable environment.
Cons
Nascent technologies and risk aversion, in some areas, portfolio might not have current industrial value proposition maturity but still lacks the requisite startup culture needed to make things happen. For such immature portfolios, there isn't any systematic process in place, have had colleagues think up product strategies on the fly - without any form of market research whatsoever. But that's something we handle at work every day. It also probably needs to attract the cream of talent Singapore and the Asia Pacific can offer. A very sales oriented environment, it's like every component is built to sell... every layer.

When very good employees have resigned, senior management have arrogantly and short-sightedly announced "we don't want them here if they don't want to be here" rather than trying to understand the cause for the rapid turnover. Also considerable loss of clients by Canon Business Services over a number of years, again due to lack of willingness to listen and change.

pros: Great team of people, great life-work balance.

pros: staff activities seem to be more than work. work life balance
cons: layer of thick dinosaurs that resist change. you have to subject yourself to rigid stupid checks that are unnecessary and inefficient. sometimes it feels more like u are back at school you have to confine yourself to old rigid checks and procedures that somtimes make no sense. if u dont conform to an activity especially if its a co wide thing, you will be regarded as having disgraced your dept/section and ostracised. colleagues are also cold and unfeeling. some even plain rude and show no mutual respect to others. impossible to strike up any conversation unless u have been here a very long time. unless u have the thickest skin and a complete robot. or else this place will kill your initiative spirit.

pros: Everyone in the company was super nice no matter what department you were from. Also, there were so many amazing events that were planned for the interns.
